text: Luther Bridge (German: Lutherbrücke) is a bridge over the Spree in Berlin, Germany. The bridge connects Spreeweg, adjacent to the Tiergarten, with Paulstraße in Moabit. ==Design and history== The bridge was built in 1892 and is named after Martin Luther, who was a seminal figure in the Protestant Reformation. The bridge was designed by architects Karl Bernhard and Otto Stahn. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1892 establishments in Germany Category:Bridges completed in 1892 Category:Bridges in Berlin Category:Buildings and structures in Mitte
title: Luther Bridge
